IMG1.jpg: Overview of terminal ileum with focal erythema adjacent to a diverticulum.
IMG2.jpg: Close-up of suspected Meckel diverticulum showing adherent clot and mucosal defect.
IMG3.jpg: Sigmoid polyp at 30 cm, flat morphology with mildly irregular surface; resected.
WL3.png: Normal colonic mucosa, no active bleeding in this field.
WL4.png: Endoscopic view showing clip placed at prior polypectomy site.
WL_55.png: Wide-field image of colon with adequate bowel preparation and visible haustra.
WL_56.png: Image demonstrating mucosal healing at prior polypectomy site.
WL_57.png: Ileocecal valve visualized with normal proximal mucosa.
WL_58.png: Localized edema near the diverticulum; no active bleeding at time of exam.
WL_59.png: Polypectomy site with visible cautery artifact and minimal oozing controlled.
WL_65.png: Wide-angle view of sigmoid colon with clear visualization of haustral folds.
WL_66.png: Close-up showing clip applied to bleeding point.
WL_67.png: Post-polypectomy inspection image showing clean resection base.
WL_68.png: Random white-light view used for documentation.
WL_69.png: Additional overview image for completeness of documentation.
